The hichiriki () is a double reed Japanese fue (flute) used as one of two main 
melodic instruments in Japanese gagaku music, the other being the ryteki. The 
hichiriki is difficult to play, due in part to its double reed configuration. Although a 
double reed instrument like the oboe, the hichiriki has a ... This article relating to 
woodwind instruments is a stub.
